info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 5:20AM EDT until April 7 at 7:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and the Florida Panhandle, including the following counties, Geneva and Holmes.
* WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartford, Slocomb, Malvern, Ponce De Leon, Caryville, Esto, Westville, Noma, Black, Miller Crossroads, Bethlehem, Smith Crossroads, Ards Crossroads, Thurston, Izagora, Holland Crossroads, New Hope, Noma Junction, Gritney and Barker Store. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING
